summary: The failure converter in the Ruby SDK is not properly defaulting the error type to an unqualified class name. The issue points to a specific line in the code that needs to extract only the class name without the module namespace.
userImpact: Application errors may not be properly converted and serialized when being passed through the Temporal workflow system, potentially causing errors to lose their type information.
rootCause: The failure converter is not extracting the unqualified class name from the error object, likely including the full module namespace instead.
proposedFix: Change the error type extraction to use `error.class.name.to_s.split('::').last` to get only the unqualified class name.
resolutionDetails: The code was updated to properly extract the unqualified class name by splitting on '::' and taking the last element.
